reviewText:
Early Access Review

What an excellent survival/combat game

TL;DR Awesome game, Amazing tension and gameplay, some rare latency issues.

Please don't be like me and write this off as another early access survival game on Steam. This game is truely a one-of-a-kind experience. The game's concept is simple enough; 16 players are throw on an island to kill each other and the last man standing is the winner. However, this is no Hunger Games. There is no ridiculous romance sub-plot, theres no uninteresting world, and there is actually some real tension (A.K.A. You are not Katniss Everdeen, you are not garunteed to survive). This game's genius comes from it's simplicity. The crafting is as simple as it gets, meaning no flipping through wikis to figure out what does what, and there's even a quick access crafting guide in the pause menu if you desperately need it. There is even a very helpful and short tutorial in the game to explain the mechanics to you. The combat is also simple in that you have three different moves at your disposal, which are your attack, block, and shove (unless you are lucky enough to find a gun or bow). The combat system is simple enough for anyone to understand it, but difficult to master.

There are also some interesting ideas that The Culling attempts to implement into the survival/crafting game formula as well. Perks are present in this game and allow you to specialize in a weapon type or different abilities. For example, my preferred loadout is built around running faster and dealing more damage with blades, while also being silent to be able to sneak up on opponents. You can also equip airdrops that can be called in and you can unlock more of them by stealing drops from other people or by getting a randomly placed supply drop in game. These airdrops add even more elements to consider when making a loadout. You can also change characters clothing that can be unlocked by completing matches.

Another interesting feature is the F.U.N.C. system. To craft an item, call in an airdrop, or open a rare crate, you will need F.U.N.C., which stands for Flexible Universal Nano Compound". This is like the game's currency system. F.U.N.C. is obtained over time from rewards
hoursPlayed: or by finding little caches of F.U.N.C. around the map (Usually in the form of human remains). This mechanic is greatly appreciated to keep the gameplay balanced and to add in a way to avoid too many care packages being obtained. What is also great is that the mechanic is also simple and accessible.\n\nAnd that is what makes this game so unique
voteText: it is a very  simple  game. These survival games keep trying to go bigger and larger
helpfulPercent: with more crafting and survival mechanics to make them "hardcore" games
votesHelpful: but no game in my life has made my heart beat out of my chest like The Culling does. And actually being the last man surviving and winning The Culling?   Pure bliss\n\nThe game's atmosphere is also on point. Instead of a scoreboard that you can pull up at any time
votesTotal: there are monitors around the map and a giant projection in the sky that display the scoreboard
votesFunny: and the announcer for the game is funny and charismatic. The sound design also was ambient and always kept me guessing if someone was sneaking up on me.\n\nWhile every fight in the culling is blood pumping tense
commentsCount: they can also be fustratingly difficult. Latency issues sometimes cause thrown items or projectiles not to hit
column16: hits won't register
column17: or people to teleport. It has not been a common issue for me (I live on the East Coast of the US)
column18: but it is extremely noticable when it occurs.\n\nThere are also some awkward animations and some missing polish in gameplay
column19: but this game could pass for a Bethesda Title. (Just kidding Bethesda
column20: I love you bb) But seriously
column21: there are early access games out there with much less polish than this (looking at  you  The Forrest.\n\nLatency issues and early access noticability aside
column22: The Culling is an excellent and intense survival game that is brutally unforgiving while still remaining simplistic. Gameplay is fun and tense
column23: the environment is cool and exotic
column24: and the sound design is really cool. I can't wait for what else the developers are going to add in the make this game even greater.\n\nAs of 4/10/2016

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Good concept, terrible execution.
First off, I liked this game at first, I thought that me dieing all the time was just me being bad and other people being better. However, after many hours put into this game and practicing I can say that it is broken, invisible cheaters, people with rifles after two minutes, and constant crashes are just a few of the many plagues of this game. Also, the melee combat  had some good ideas like the whole block stagger concept, but it kinda loses me when a fully charged sledgehammer gets stopped by someone's bare forearms. All in all this game is a mess and the team gamemode, don't even start me on the team gamemode. I get spawned 700+ meters away from my teammate while a team gets adjoining spawns? In any way how is that fair? When the combat gets utterly broken in a two on one fight because one person makes you block in the front while the other stun-locks you in the back starting a non-ending cluster♥♥♥♥ of your screen shaking and you losing health until you die. And don't even ask me how a light shove almost knocks out a full-grown muscular man to the point of him not being able to do anything, just don't.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

*edit as of 5/19/2016*
I can see now where the skill system is a bit one-sided. The ability to drain an enemy's stamina is rediculous and I found playing right after a patch only yields to people who most likely played way longer than I have, making the matches one-sided.

Example:
I was so scared of people draining my stamina from their one-sided abilities (which happened 3 games in a row sending me directly back to a 3 minute queue time) that if I saw an open box or heard conflict I ran. Crafted gear served me no purpose other than stalling my demise. Call me bad at the game, sure, but my hours prove I am unexperienced in comparison to what I was matched up against. Can't run away or anything because all my stamina is gone from them pegging me while I had block up. Blocking doesn't drain stamina anymore, but it appears their perks cut through and still apply to your overall stamina pool.

I stand with my decision of this being a good game, however things like this need to be fixed before it leaves early access.

*end edit*
*begin original post*
I have only played this game for a short amount of time and every time I play I have an adrenaline-fueled panic attack.

Games good. Enough said.

I do not recommend this game for anyone with an arrhythmias condition.

On that note (and after reading other people's reviews"):
[Note: I have played post what appears to be the 'loadout' phase]
*The perk system is not unforgiving: hardly any increase damage and the ones that do are on crafted gear / brass knuckles / thrown weapons (most are weak)
*Guns are OP for a reason: YOU ARE MENT TO OUT SMART A GUN USER
*Crafting is a vital asset to the game
*Loading problems are hardware based
date: only downside is finding a match\n*Game emphasises smart players
voteText: and retreat as needed.\n*This is a game show set on an island: I wouldn't expect a new map
helpfulPercent:
just RNG the buildings/spawns
*I hardly (currently never) see teaming in free-for-all: not unless the enemies trying to kill the person with the backpack and then each other.
*Anyone can craft a bow: rock + rock = Knife / Knife + stick = Spear / Spear + Stick = Bow
*Game awards cosmetics EVERY TIME you perform well: you don't even need to kill
votesHelpful: just survive.\n\nSo again before you go around thinking every negative review is right
votesTotal:
know this:
*Still early access

*A fresh breath of air in the game development scene that involves crafting anything to survive

Buy it. Try it for 1 hour 59 minutes. Dont like it then refund it. But this game is going to be

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is honestly really worth the money spent on it. Just like in most competetive games people do not like change which is the reason for most of the bad reviews in my opinion. This is early access and people are not expecting big changes like this is a release game. Give the game a shot if you are looking into it. They do changes fairly often (about 2 times a month). I still do not regret my purchase of this game despite what others think of it.

PROS:
-Really good survival arena game
-Much easier for newer players to get into with the new economy (no more teir 4 weapons or guns in the first couple minutes of the game, those are ending of mid game towards end game.)
-Game pacing is really good now with all weapons seeing play with combat speed changes and economy.
-Has a decent upper end community that is willing to help newer players learn the ropes.(LiBrizzi and Anthony just to name a couple. I watch LiBrizzi regularly)
-Patches at a REGULAR RATE with a lot of changes.
-Chat is only available after death

CONS:
-Patches at a regular rate with a LOT OF CHANGES. (this can be bad due to the shifting play each patch but this is due to Early Access)
-A few bugs in combat system
-Typical competitive playerbase (players being rude in spectator chat)

All in all I love this game. If you are interested in it watch some streams. I play this game every single day that I am home. It is a great game to look into, and if you want to, to invest your money into their Early Access.

See you in the arena,
Syrekroth

reviewText:
Early Access Review

One of the best games I've played in a while. The devs are super active with the community and really transparent. The game does have it's faults like most games but they tend to sort them out rather quickly. The game allows you to play however you'd like, for example I prefer to be a range based player so I use bow perks and a bow airdrop. This meshes well with my 2's partner who is a super aggressive tank-like player. Overall I would highly recommend picking this game up, especially with a friend.

As for how the game runs, you do need a decent computer to actually properly play the game. One of the first things I would recommend before you start playing is disable shadows. Adjusting the graphics/render distance is completely up to you but disabling the shadows is super important.

I get about 60-100fps so there isn't any issue for me.

The audio/sound in the game is very well done. I can identify certain sounds from good ranges and which direction the sound came from very easily. This is important especially in these types of games.

Overall 8.5/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

One of the best games I've played in a while. The devs are super active with the community and really transparent. The game does have it's faults like most games but they tend to sort them out rather quickly. The game allows you to play however you'd like, for example I prefer to be a range based player so I use bow perks and a bow airdrop. This meshes well with my 2's partner who is a super aggressive tank-like player. Overall I would highly recommend picking this game up, especially with a friend.

As for how the game runs, you do need a decent computer to actually properly play the game. One of the first things I would recommend before you start playing is disable shadows. Adjusting the graphics/render distance is completely up to you but disabling the shadows is super important.

I get about 60-100fps so there isn't any issue for me.

The audio/sound in the game is very well done. I can identify certain sounds from good ranges and which direction the sound came from very easily. This is important especially in these types of games.

Overall 8.5/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The Culling is a fun take on Battle Royale. Ever get those butt clenching moments when you're trying to clutch on Counter-Strike? You pretty much feel like that all the time in The Culling. There's something so satisfying about winning a fight, or better yet, the actual match, that I just don't get with other games. Its just a pure adrenaline rush.

The crafting in this game doesn't get in the way, and I like how its handled. You want some more arrows for your bow? Oh hey, just rub this stick against your bow and the nanites inside you will take care of the rest!

Combat is nice and simple, and no one ever has a huge advantage weapon-wise... if you're tactical about the engagement. I've been in various combat scenarios where I'm simply out-gunned but I'll come out on top. This guy has a rifle? Pffft, I'll move tree-to-tree and pepper spray the guy and disarm him as I repeatedly impale him with my dirty spear. I've been out-numbered and ganged up on, but with a bit of luck and careful combat... you can easily clutch! I've intercepted other people's airdrops and used it against them! Simply put, its fun to be in combat and you'll never know what's going to happen when you're fighting another player like yourself who's desperately fighting for their life too.

You have perks that you can use to suit your playstyle, and there's also airdrops to help reinforce that. You can unlock airdrops by opening ones you haven't discovered yet.

Team fights are also fun, you and a buddy vs 14 other people paired off into teams of two.

Good luck, contestants!

All in all: 10/10

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI wish there was a mixed recemend option for reviews, because that is what this deserves. Yes this game is great, good job devs on making a good battle royal for once. Is this game worth $16.99? Well that is what I would like to find out. Pros to The Culling:  1. Beatiful graphics. Honestly this game is beautiful, great job on the scene. 2. Great physics. Physics are so important, and I am glad to see that they put effort in the realism of it. 3. Gameplay. Like I said before, best battle royal game. It is structured like the hunger games (the cornucopia in the middle) creating a well balance level. Very few good weapons, and money management also come into play in this game. Again well done. So where does The Culling go wrong? It seems like it is the perfect game... well not exactly. Cons:  1. Gets boring. I know some might say it does not, but lets be real here, there is only one map with the same gameplay every time. I was done with it after an hour. If you play with freinds yes it is more enjoyable, but still gets old after a short amount of time. This being said I did have a lot of fun in that hour.  2. Games are long. I know I should not be saying this as I am a csgo player, but still it is a little annoying sometimes. You will spend 15 mins getting the perfect gear together, and then you get hunted down. Now this does not happen all the time (thank god) but it still feels like a bit long of a game 20mins. I don't see this one ever changing in the future so just keep that in mind before you buy it, can I spend 20mins on each game?".    So there you have it
recommended: am I for or against The Culling? I am not sure really. I say buy it if you are interested in long strategic survival. If you are caught in the hype just wait a little
hoursPlayed: the price will go down and you will get your shot at winning the games. Hopefully this game will get some new maps and game types in the future. Hope you liked my review."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I got this game despite the recent hate it has received. I have to say, I don't see where the hate is coming from, I've played multiple sessions in both single and teams and never had any major issue except for one case of lag which still resulted in me getting a kill.
If you don't have a gaming setup or even a good gaming laptop, don't blame a game for that, you chose to buy your laptop or pc with its specs. I am saying this because I've played on my laptop and experienced no issues aside from the aforementioned single instance of lag.

The Culling isn't a perfect game and I do wish they would implement a sort of 'Crafted Weapons Only' gameplay so that it would require slightly more skill to play. I haven't run across guns I have seen the devastating power of explosives and how easily having just one can change the game.

Ultimately I enjoy the game and will continue to play it.

Edit: I will say the biggest flaw of the game is where you start, whether it be in singles or teams. Some players start off right beside buildings loaded with loot and others start in the middle of nowhere and I feel this system needs to be balaned in some way for it to be entirely fair. Too often I have had sessions where other players start off fully equipped and I have little more than a spear.

Early Access Review

I think I now have enough game hours to state my review.  I am very lenient when it comes to reviewing EA games (my library has a lot of them) so bear with me.  In addition, I would say I'm pretty good at the game, I'm not a noob.

I really loved this game when it released. I encouraged a few friends to buy it, which they did, and we had tons of fun together.  It's initial gameplay was balanced and was an exhilarating experience.

However, each update seems to be making the game worse. I don't have a problem with framerates, textures, and perks.  What I do have a problem with this is the hand-to-hand combat, unbalanced weapons, lag, and a toxic community, (particullary players aka teamers" team up together
recommended: to win - unfair)\n\nMy main gripe is with the fighting combat.  The melee combat has become just a joke
hoursPlayed: it's become a shove-to-victory game.  Aside from the shove->hit->shove->hit I want to address also the lag issues.\n\nLag. I have always a great connection
voteText: I rarely lag on my end.  However when hand-to-hand fighting with a "lagger" trying to win the fight is just a dice roll.\n\nThe community is incredibly hostile.  On most of the discussions
helpfulPercent: users just shred apart each other (with their opinions) and thus are not very helpful.\n\nFree-for-all. Ahh it used to be so much fun
votesHelpful: a good challenge.  Since the implementation of tokens
votesTotal: many players choose to "team up" in FFA matches.  As a result
votesFunny: in most FFA matches you will end up fighting a two-man team.  While the developers and community are taking measures against this
commentsCount: it is not very effective.\n\nMoreover
column16: I used to love this game. I had so many great times playing with friends and going solo in FFA matches.  But each subsequent update seems to be just ruining the game.  Since I am now disinclined to play it
column17: I recommend holding off purchasing this game.  However I do sugggest that keep checking back
column18: once or twice a month
column19: to see if the game has been restored to what it should be.\n\nP.S. I already know this is coming. "It's an EA game

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Amazing game, really. Some work to be done, but 9.5/10 in it's current state for me. Let's get into it-

The Culling is an amazing battle royale-type game with little to no faults.
A lot of people say that the announcer's voice gets annoying, but after 28 hours+ of play, I don't find it annoying in the slightest. The gameplay isn't repetetive at all, which is great. There's a nice array of weapons in the game as well, which keeps gameplay fresh. Guns and Bows aren't OP either, you can literally disarm them with a well-aimed rock. The combat itself is really refreshing, too. it's pretty different from the other survival/battle royale" games out there. It's somewhat like Rock Paper Scissors. There's Block
recommended: and Push. Push will knock back a blocking enemy
hoursPlayed: and an attack on a blocking player will knock you back. You can throw any weapon or item
voteText: and backstabs deal a nice amount of bonus damage. I'm not that great at writing reviews

reviewText:
Early Access Review

After playing this game for only a total of 6 hours, I can hounestly say i've had more fun in any battle arena style game playing this than I have any other.

I feel inclinded to share my last game, which is something i've never witnessed with my own eyes in game before, bar recoreded video on youtube etc. and i'm sure there is more and better encounters to come.

- Spawn into game 20m from loot building
- find nothing worth keeping bar remote C4 which was in a free crate
- run through jungle to next building
- in this distance i can hear sounds of lockers being ripped open... someone is here
- i get closer and hear the splatter of water... someone else is hear
- they start to punch on like two savage animals
- with no weapon, i kreep over to the blue sell item vending machine and place my c4 on the front
- the savages are still fighting
- i creep behind a corner and wait
- some poor soul dies, and the unsuspecting winner loots his body to sell the goods
- i hear the vending machine activate from behind the corner
- BOOM  GOES THE DYNAMITE
- instant kill with the body obliterating to nothing
- i manage to scavange all loot which included a tier 3 weapon & MORE C4 while uncontrollably laughing
- also found a blowdart gun, but no ammo
- as im scavaging ammo from one of the gas canisters an arrow penetrates my back
- frazeled i turn to fight, slashing away at each other untlil i release the health war is in his favour
- as death was imminant i dropped the C4 at my feet, and with one slash away from death, hit the kill switch
- BOOM GOES THE DYNAMITE
- we both explode
- kill confirmed and game over

one of the best times you can have in 10mins

Has hours of fun fresh replay, with an arry of combinations with weapons, perks, airdrops, items and your general environment

Seriously recommend to anybody, especially the team mode.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is early access and I am writing the review on it's current state.

Now, I might be bias, as this is one of the types of games I've been looking forward to for several years. I've been interested in a game that was reminiscent of The Hunger Games, and I've finally found one. The game plays great, with some issues like crashing every once in a while and bad frames here and there, but it's such a fun game!

There's crafting, which is how you make bandages, ammunition, and starting weapons. Then there's item crates where you can get more powerful weapons, and finally airdrops, which give you kits for a big pricetag.

I enjoy this game not only because it's what I've been looking for, but also because of the playability. No match is the same, and don't get discouraged when you keep losing, as I haven't won once. I also am pretty happy with the graphics.

Pros:
-Cool game style
-No microtransactions (Yet, please don't add them.)
-Good graphics
-Great sound effects

Cons:
-Crashing and minor frameskips as said above
-Shadows, Anti-Aliasing, etc are very taxing when it comes to FPS which I hope will be fixed
-Bad textures for the first half minute when starting a match, but it fixes itself after that
-No servers outside the U.S. (I live in the U.S. so I don't really care about this, but others do...that's mostly why there's negative reviews right now.)

Guys, I have hope that these developers are gonna do their job well and make this into a great game. There's so much content that's here already and I can't wait to see what else they throw into it in the next months/years. Yes I recommend this purchase. Yes I think you should buy this. The cons aren't that bad when it comes to how fun this game is; I'd recommend this to everyone. Cheers.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A few patches ago, the combat was so satisfying, you could react to people's actions, and win. If they blocked, you shoved, if they attacked, you blocked, if they shove you attack. You had time to drop your block and attack if you saw the shove coming, you had time to shove if you saw their block coming up, you had time to react, but the last few patches have slowly been adding more time where a shove staggers you after you drop the block, and things like that. So now, reacting is damn near impossible, because even if you drop your block in time they can still stagger you, so the combat that was so tight and satisfying when I bought the game devolved into just guess what they're gonna do next and spam things".

On top of that

Early Access Review

6/3... the lack of regulation and anticheat is ruining this game as much or more than the updates/downgrades...
6/2 Edit: Edit: Another Culling update... another gameplay DOWNGRADE... This game is like crack... I keep coming back for more even though I know it's horrible... I need to do like all my friends who have this game AND DELETE IT... AND THEN CHECK  INTO REHAB... This is like a kick to the testes... Thanks for being like my mother Xaviant and getting my hopes up for nothing... Take a couple of fistfuls of the money you've made and HIRE A TEAM WHO CAN ACTUALLY IMPROVE THE GAME...

Edit: I spent over an hour today waiting to get into trials and FFA matches only to be sent back to the lobby... This game concept awesome... please focus on fixing combat and net code before worrying about tweaking small details. Big picture then small details.

So far...This is a waste of time and money.

Game isn't broken, it just doesn't work. Every update it seems to get further and further from being what I would think it's meant to: a game that requires skill and cunning. Seems to be more about luck, ping, and button spamming.

Don't expect a game that you can get better at.

Buy if you like waiting in line for 3 to 5 minutes to get booted, game crashes, no anticheat, broken combat, exploits, and wasting your time.

Other than all that... ITS GREAT

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Despite my 240 hours spent in this game i cant recommand this game actualy.
This game used to be fun and enjoying to play, but the more the developers add to this game the worse it gets.
Hmm, Where should i start ? First, its like the developers have literraly no clue about what they're doing, they add features which dont make any sense at all. Particularly, the whole combat system, the gameplay, its a rock/paper/system, it means, in melee, you have 3 actions available : Attack, Push or Block. It has its own pros and cons. But now, thanks to the developers and their great guideline, it became an Attack/Push/Push game since Block is useless, the game tend to encourage players to spam pushing. Thats one of the many examples which illustrate how aware the developers are about the path to take (i hope you detected the sarcasm here). Something else, they had slowed drastically all the melee weapon's attack speed, so much that they had to revert the changes with a few patchs. I told you, they have no clue about what they're doing, its realy scary.
To be honnest, when i'm playing this game i feel like i'm on a rollercoaster because head upside down, this is how i feel this game, this messy and clunky gameplay.

I wish this game had a real skilled-based gameplay (like Chivalry), but thats not the case at all, its too much RNG-based. RNG can be good for games, as long as you control it, too much RNG kill games. Of course
maybe i'll update this review if this game becames interesting to play. Because, Yes, its a good game. Is it fun to play ? Definitively not anymore.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I love what this game is going for and trying to be but cannot recommend it at this time because it's just way too janky and buggy.  The melee combat - a core mechanic in this game - feels stiff, choppy, and inaccurate - and this is coming from someone with hundreds of hours playing Chivalry.  The game is poorly optimized, stutters frequently, and has graphical problems abound.  I cannot even put this game into fullscreen or it flips out and my monitor starts flickering.

I had some very satisfying moments in this game, and the immersion with a pair of surround sound headphones is great.  I also really appreciate a survival type game that doesn't have motherf*cking zombies in it.  The vast majority of my time however was spent feeling frustrated with the controls and stuttering problems.  I only didn't refund this game in hopes that the developers can fix these netcode and graphics optimization problems and improve the controls when they actually finish this game.

UPDATE:  I wanted to edit my review as I have continued to play anyways because I have friends who foolishly bought this game too early also.  I would like to give this game TWO thumbs down at this time instead of just one, there seem to be some serious shenanigans with hackers and exploiters right now on top of its other problems.  I lose every game to players who have tier 4 weapons and guns waaaayyy to early in the match to have acquired them legitimately.  Sometimes you get lucky with good finds early on, but this is happening far too consistently to attribute it to mere luck.  This game has cheaters.

The devs for this game should be ashamed and embarrassed to charge this much for such a clearly unfinished product.  Of course they aren't actually, they are laughing all the way to the bank.  I hope they don't flake out and evaporate like some developers do with early access titles on Steam and actually make this game good.  The concept is still great which I think is what truly is driving the interest and excitement for this game, because it's definitely not the actual gameplay that's doing it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Just plain fun!

The Culling is a free for all game, a la Hunger Games. You can either choose to go in solo vs. 16 other players or pick a buddy and compete versus 7 other teams of two.

You get dropped at a random point in the map and have to loot/craft items to be able to defend yourself in the inevitable fight to the death. The weapons are very melee centered, even though it is fairly easy to get your hands on any of the various bows early on. Firearms however seem to be very hard to come by.

You can also fully customize your character with drops you receive at the end of each 20 minute match. These scale in rarity depending on how well you do during the game.

I have had a lot of fun with this title so far and hope the developer keeps going in the right direction, as this game has great potential. The only con I can think of right now is that there is only one map and it is on the small/medium side, but I also know there are plans to bring us more maps so I will adjust this review as we go.

CONS:

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I joined a team game expecting to be matched with some trolling fool but instead I was greeted by a helpful, friendly fellow. I looked forward to the adventures we'd have on the island.

We started off crafting and picking up loot as we travelled through the terrains and as if by magic we were soon stacked with some wonderful tools. He sported the bow and arrow whereas I chose the classic spear. After a few minutes of walking we face our first enemies whom were already in combat with another pairing. My new found friend and I hold back until one of the pairs had been murdered. Finally our chance came; we charged forth, arrows blazing. We took down the already wounded with ease and picked up some great loot. I got myself a rifle and a sword and my compatriot grabbed himself a brand spanking new recurve bow. Our journey then continued.

As we continued walking through the depths of the forest we stumbled across a building. I go ahead to search it through and through but I was stopped in my tracks by some sort of explosive bringing me down to a frightening 1HP. However my good pal seemed to be very clued up in medical sciences as he began to craft bandages out of sticks (I know, crazy right?) I was soon patched up and we began trekking towards the maps centre.

By now there were only 5 left, us, another pair and one lone survivor who'd already lost his partner in crime. We reached the centre, I activated the kill switch and we waited for the fun to begin. However the wait didn't last long as the first pairing came through the brush clearly up for a fight. My trusty partner fended them off with his bow as I went to craft some ammunition for my rifle. I was back just in time as our rival pair had moved up and began engaging in close quarter combat with my buddy. I rushed in firing my only four shots at one of the attackers, filling him with lead, killing him outright. The last of the pair was easy pickings and he was down quickly.

Now it was just the one lonesome survivor and us. We had to win, surely. I was still bleeding from our rival’s offensive bringing me down to 1HP again. My partner on the other hand was on half health so I believed we could still win this. All of a sudden in the corner of my eye I saw someone run up the ramp next to me. He wasn't highlighted so I knew it wasn't my partner and incredibly he hadn't noticed me. I wielded my sword, snuck up behind and killed him in one swipe... Nice work genius you just killed your partner" rang out from the announcer’s mouth. As I realised what I had just done an arrow from the bow of our final enemy strikes me in the head killing me instantly. I was flabbergasted; words couldn't describe the disappointment I had brought upon myself. I proceeded to turn my PC off and go for a lonesome walk reflecting on my actions.

R.I.P Partner
date: gone but never forgotten (I'm really sorry!)"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL;DR                                                                                                                                                                                                            The Culling is a challenging and fun multiplayer survival game where 16 people have to fight in an arena till there is only one left.

My actual try on a review:

This game suprised me, i though it would be like a generic battle royal game, with crappy weapon balance, spawns and combat. How i was wrong. This game is very different from the other popular BR game, H1Z1 King of the Kill. While the objective is the same (be the last one alive) it does it in such a good way that matches, which are around 25 minutes, pass so fast. So im gonna be looking at some aspect of the game.

Melee Combat:
Melee Combat is simple, but complex in a way. There are 5 main actions: weak attack, strong attack, throw, block and push. While it does feel a bit weird, its highly satisfying to win a fight in this game. Blocking someone gets you a a small time window to hit your enemy and blocking protects you form all sort of melee damage. The only way to break a block is to push the enemy and doing so will stun the blocker for a small time, which is enough time to hit them. Throwing a weapon gets you a hit, even if they are blocking but you lose your weapon by doing so. Attacking and pushing wastes stamina, so keep your eye on that.

Long range attacks:
There are many ranged way of attacking someone in this game, such has: bows, guns, grenades and poison darts.
There is nothing different in this type of battle from another FPS. Also if you get hit while having a long range weapon, you will be disarmed of said weapon.

Stats/Effects:
There are status and effects that weapons and stims (pretty much drugs) will give a player, such has: bleed, poison, weakness, damage protection, more damage, faster stamina recovery, more speed, etc. Weapons cause the bad ones (of course) while stims buff the player.

Crafting:
What sets this game apart from others is its crafing system. The game gives you a crafting recipes which you can check by pressing ESC. To craft an item you will need FUNC, which is sort  of a ingame currency, that has a lot more uses (will be talking about that).

FUNC:
This is a pretty important aspect of the game. You need FUNC to craft, heal, open weapon crates and to call an airdrop. You get FUNC for killing other players, from random corpses that you find and from a FUNC recicle station.This station allows you to recicle an item that you have for FUNC. The higher the tier of the item, more FUNC it will give.  The healing" aspect of FUNC is the ability to use a health station.

Looting:
There are some building which contain lockers
date: that may or may not have something in them. The most probable way of finding something is by opening weapon crates. There are 3 crates: green
recommended: blue and red. The green ones are free to open
hoursPlayed:
the blue ones cost 50 FUNC and the red one need an explosive device to open them.


That everything that I feel like its important. There are more feature that i did not talk about.

Overall
voteText: is a pretty good game. It may have its problems here and there but other than that

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSo, yes it's alpha, and no it isn't completely breaking new ground, but holy crap this game is fun. I've played a solid 50+ rounds, and I have to say I'm haing a blast. The hit boxes are a bit wonky, and if you shoot an arrow or a poisoned dart from a high elevation the projectile mysteriously plummets to the earth, but otherwise this game is FUN. I've only knocked 5 victories, but I can definitely say that each win fully warrants a massive fist pump/jump out of the chair and dance around a little. (what, no one can see me, stop judging me you ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ly trolls) Given that the victories are so hard won I'd love to see a little celebratory, in game third person vid and/or replay of your kills when you're the last man standing. (c'mon devs, that wouldn't be that hard, and would be completely sick!!!) Still needs some balancing (bows seem kinda weak, and guns should be MUCH louder), but overall, a slaughter filled, glorious romp.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I absolutely recommend this game! It's a cross between the hunger games (movie) and a B rated action film where everyone is dying and blood is on everything.

Pros
This game isn't pretending to be anything that its not, its new, its violent and its unforgiving.
It's fairly balanced.
It looks really good.
The controls are easy and are able to be changed if you want.

Cons
A LITTLE bit of hit detection could be tuned.
Weapon damage seems low, if you hit for 5-15 (with your fists) - shouldn't your bow do more than 6-16?

Overall, especially for 13-15 dollars. This game is 100% worth it right now. As long as the devs keep up with any cheaters that may arise, this will be glorious.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you've wanted to play a battle royale game but not wanted to spend 30+ minutes without finding a single other player and getting your head blown off from a mile away... This is your game.
Huge focus on melee combat instead of ranged, guns are EXTREMELY rare and there's even a team mode where you can que together with a friend and fight as a team against other teams. The map is small, which I love. But not 'too' small for 16 players, and each match takes around 20 minutes. Because of that, you run into people fairly often. Even if you find something valuable and get killed, it won't be like you lost a bunch of time.

That being said, it's very obviously an early access game. Melee combat is clunky. Very clunky. If you make it to the last few, odds are most of them have bows and some pretty dangerous weapons. But there are good times to be had for the price.

Oh, and two sticks makes a bandage. Because of course it does, have you never made a bandage before?

reviewText:
Early Access Review

PROS: Fun and competitive game concept with balanced and accurate melee system
Perks are well balanced for an E-sports scene
Animations are great for an early access title
Availibility of weapons is proportionately appropriate to game length
New maps already confirmed, with potential for more perks and weapons as well as survival factors like cold/heat

CONS: Some spawns leave players with great advantage or disadvantage
Currently only 2-man teams in multiplayer, though other game modes have been confirmed for the future
Occasional optimization issues (FPS drops, slow loading on startup/shut down, disconnects) although I have                   experienced none of these personally
One week into early access and already several hacks have emerged, **needs immediate developer attention**
Potential for game-breaking cash/item shop institution, an immediate no-buy if that happens

FINAL EVALUATION: I wanted to give this game a 9/10, but because of the available hacks and the frequency with which I encounter them, I can't give it better than a 7. Without immediate correction I think the player base will dissolve within 3 months, HOWEVER if an anti-cheat is effected in time and the issue is resolved, the game has nowhere to go but up. Best potential in a PvP game I've seen since DayZ Arma2 mod. I recommend it for 15$.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I absolutely recommend this game! It's a cross between the hunger games (movie) and a B rated action film where everyone is dying and blood is on everything.

Pros
This game isn't pretending to be anything that its not, its new, its violent and its unforgiving.
It's fairly balanced.
It looks really good.
The controls are easy and are able to be changed if you want.

Cons
A LITTLE bit of hit detection could be tuned.
Weapon damage seems low, if you hit for 5-15 (with your fists) - shouldn't your bow do more than 6-16?

Overall, especially for 13-15 dollars. This game is 100% worth it right now. As long as the devs keep up with any cheaters that may arise, this will be glorious.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Basically it's Hunger Games the Game.
You start in a box in random location on the map and trying to be the only one who survives to the end by any means necessary.

You earn FUNC - local currency for doing stuff like loot human remains, killing players and release poison gas. You use said currency to open boxes, craft: armor, weapons, traps and bandages as well as calling an airdrop.

Lay traps, use poison darts and range weapons and if battle goes badly - throw smoke bomb and run like a coward.

I've tried to play other survival games but they never seemed to have this feeling of actual survival - using all you can for your advantage, clutch 1 on 1 battles which often comes down to throwing all you have in your pockets at the enemy as last resort.

For now game have only two modes - Solo and Teams of 2 on NA servers. And only one Map.

Game have some cosmetic rewards and more airdrops options unlocks as you find them in the game.

Matches lasts about 15-20 mins.

Even in its early stage game is good and looks promising. But it's still alpha so bugs, crashes and technical problems are real.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I am shocked by how much I like this game. I have been burned by early access in the past and I was hesitant to buy in due to the usual worries of devs abandoning the title, rampant bugs, and there just not being enough content yet to be enjoyable. Well don't worry about all that. I'm 24+ hours in after a week with the game and I'm happy to report that I have only found a few bugs and I'm still finding new strategies to be the last man standing with the current expansive range of perks, airdrops, weapons, and traps.

The gameplay rewards skill and strategy above who finds a gun first, which is a refreshing change of pace from other battle royale modes. I have won multiple rounds with tier 1 weapons, stealth, and skill. A gun will absolutely help your cause but getting hit with melee attacks while you have a ranged weapon equipped will cause you to drop your weapon on the ground. This is a brilliant balance mechanic that allows you to turn the tables on any gun wielding maniacs that don't realize you're in melee range.

The rounds are currently 25 minutes long and you're free to leave and find a new match if you're killed off early. Poisonous gas starts to pour in the arena from all sides once there are 10 minutes left to ensure that the remaining players are forced into a fight.

The game has 3 different playlists: free for all, free for all against bots, or teams which is split up into 8 teams of 2. Teams mode can also be played with a steam friend or just a randomly matched player if you haven't been doing a good enough job of bugging your friends to buy this game. At the end of any non-bot match, you're rewarded with a random cosmetic item for your character.

The game currently only features text chat between dead players and between teammates which is great. You get all the pulse racing intensity of a battle royale game without having to deal with 15 year olds that want to show you how many bad words they know.

Overall, this is an insanely fun game with tons of depth to keep you coming back to sharpen your hunting skills and try out new strategies. If the trailer even vaguely looks like something you would enjoy, buy it!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A big thumbs up for this EA game. As a fan of films like The Running Man, The Condemned, The Hunger Games.....even Logan's Run, this game made me think about all of those films and what I enjoy about them. Why? Because this game pits man against man in a game of death, It's set out as a game show, and only one can survive.


- The Combat

It gets the job done and is pretty straight forward. You have attack, block and push. This is done in rock, paper, scissors fashion. While it is decent, I don't find it very thrilling or exciting and as a main part of the game, I hope this gets some love. To make this more enjoyable, for me, I would like to see aimed blocking and a few different attack directions so it feels more like a fight to the death rather than a snooze fest. It doesn't feel brutal or blood thirsty

- The Map

It is a nice size and seems to work well with 16 players. You are not constantly fighting while trying to salvage scraps to create things you will need to survive. More often than not, you have room to breathe and take your time to plan. The environment consists of trees, shrubs, lakes, caves, buildings and bridges. It looks nice and seems well designed. The map closes in on the players at certain timed intervals to ensure the players must fight, and if this gets down to the final minutes, you will find yourself surrounded by toxic gas in the centre of the map with the remaining players.

- Traps/Gadgets/Perks

It would take me too long to list them all, but you can have a lot of fun mixing up your perks to compliment your weapon or gadget of choice. For example, you might like using the blow pipe and using 'cripple insurance' perk. You might prefer to be able to craft things twice as fast....there's a perk for that. The point is, there should be a play style that you can come up with by using the tools available. Some better than others. You have the stealthy type. The tank type. The trap setting type. The archer....the list goes on.

- The servers (EU)

I have not had any issues with lag, latency or anything else. It has been consistently smooth for me. That said, I do have a very good connection and decent speed 160/16. I'm no internet technician, but that's what I have.

- Performance

This runs perfect for me. Others on the forum have reported it does not run as great for them. I have not had a single frame skip, stutter, launching issue, crash to desk top or anything else.

GTX 980 Ti
i7 4790
16 gigs
Windows 10

- The Dishonest Players

They exist. The dev team are apparently workng towards reducing these numbers. I can't confirm I have even met one yet, but there's plenty of reports on the forum regarding this issue. Being realistic, this is always going to be a problem for us all, in this game or the next.

- Price

I think the price is really cheap considering the amount of fun there is to be had. When an EA game comes out, and I think they have a good product, I always do a few giveaways. I have done 2 so far (first winner didn't claim and it rolled over) because even if the dev team jumped ship right now, the game is still very fun in it's current state and worth the price.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

While the Battle Royale sub genre might not be new, the game certainly adds enough to the series to make it a worthwhile play.

You've probably heard of movies where a group of contestants are thrown into an arena to fight to the death. The Culling is just that, in all of its glory. The goal of the game is simple: craft, survive, and hunt. Use whatever you can find to kill others in horrible ways. The title adds an additional spin on this system however, in allowing you to call in care packages to help you out. Body armor, stimulants, and high powered weaponary  are a few of the things you can receive from these chests, and they can allow you to slaughter lesser armed foes easily. There's a catch with this however. A drone brings the supplies to you, and they can be seen and shot down by other players with bows and arrows. They also require a rather large amount of in game resources to call in. This brings up another interesting part of the game.

Crafting is very prominant, and relies on the aforementioned supply resource. Using only rocks, sticks, and a nanomachine type material you can craft practically everything you need in the game. This may seem simple, but the reduction of the amount of things you need to look for greatly speeds up the game. Two rocks makes a knife, a knife and a stick makes a spear, two sticks makes a bandage, etc. Crafting low tech weapons, armor, and traps at the begining of the game is extremely important, so that you can transition into searching for gear around the map. A bow and arrow won't really help you when your up against a rifle or submachine gun.

The balance is surprisingly good. Gear appears in chests around the map. To open these however, you need a fairly ample supply of the nanomachine material. You can scavenge around the map to safely accrue this or, attempt to kill players to gather large amounts.  As a result, there's a risk reward system in place. More aggressive players can tech up faster, but risk dying much more quickly. Scavengers have a less chance of dying, but can fall behind rather quickly. But if you're down and out with nothing but your bare hands, you're not instantly dead. A single hit with a melee weapon can disarm a player using a ranged weapon. If you play your cards right, you can catch that guy with his automatic weapon off guard and take it off his hands. There is also a final method for obtaining gear, but it involves moving to the center of the map where supplies are dropped, which needless to say, is dangerous.

To add another level of depth to the game, you can customize you characters with 3 perks. Theres a rather large selection at the moment, probably in the range of  40-60. You can increase various stats or profiencies, and even start out with certain gear. Do you want to be a berserker type character, that starts out with armor, high amounts of stamina, and the ability to regenerate health? What about a marksmen, with heightened ranged damage and speed? What about a deadly trapmaster, who can carry extra materials and build improved hazards that impede and harm the enemy? Theres a large variety of perks you can choose, and it really adds to the game in that many players behave differently.

The game has a few tutorials to help you get started, and beyond that you can play a match or two with bots to get your feet wet. Having only played two hours, I have a fairly good idea of what I need to do, if thats to give you any indication.

--------The Good--------
+Simple but effective crafting system
+An oddly appropriate ambience, think Clap Trap from borderlands being the sportscaster
+Fairly decent gameplay balance
+Allows for a large variety of play styles
+Very affordable price



--------The Bad--------

-Optimization issues. Playable, but not as good as it should be.
-As far as I can tell, only a single, albeit large, map to play on
-Melee could use a bit more oomph. Currently only Hit, Strong hit, block, and shove
-No all chat as of right now. Not even the ability to speak locally with those around you. Team and spectator chat is available however. Whether this is appropriate or not is up to you. It could be seen as a plus or a minus based on how you look at it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Note: I also alpha tested the week of 2/27.

The Culling is, essentially, a Hunger Games videogame. 16 players are pitted against each other in a fight to the death, having to scavenge for weapons and crafting resources. The Culling plays in 25 minute matches with a last-man standing objective.

Pros:
-Amazing concept
-Good crafting system
-Interested loot/weapons
-High replayability

Cons:
-Graphics (Early Access)
-Only 2 modes (again, Early Access)
-Combat can seem repetitive

Overall: 8/10
Can't wait to see Xaviant finish this game!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you've wanted to play a battle royale game but not wanted to spend 30+ minutes without finding a single other player and getting your head blown off from a mile away... This is your game.
Huge focus on melee combat instead of ranged, guns are EXTREMELY rare and there's even a team mode where you can que together with a friend and fight as a team against other teams. The map is small, which I love. But not 'too' small for 16 players, and each match takes around 20 minutes. Because of that, you run into people fairly often. Even if you find something valuable and get killed, it won't be like you lost a bunch of time.

That being said, it's very obviously an early access game. Melee combat is clunky. Very clunky. If you make it to the last few, odds are most of them have bows and some pretty dangerous weapons. But there are good times to be had for the price.

Oh, and two sticks makes a bandage. Because of course it does, have you never made a bandage before?

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pretty fun for the price, but painful without a friend.

The sounds and graphics are good, no music, mildly interesting announcer, decent variety of equipment.  Only one map, but it's a decent size (and only mildly interesting).

For a game 100% about combat, it needs some work.  Backstabs are overpowered and the basic rock-paper-scissors/swing-block-push is too simplistic, in my opinion, for a game with no other content than melee combat (and a few ranged weapons).

Poison gas is awesome.


Get it with a friend.  But without the release of more content, I can see the game dying relatively quickly.  (More hats doesn't count as more content)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm not usually big on early access games after buying Dayz, The Forest and Rust. Dont get me wrong i've had my fun with them and they are great games but The culling is the first game I have bought just days after release and really REALLY enjoyed. I can load up pop right into a game lasting 25 mins and have fun and that is exactly what I wanted from my purchase.

Pros:
-User friendly interface
-Simple Crafting
-Chivalry like combat
-Lots of items to find
-Co-op
-CHEAP
-Perk customization to tweak your experience
-Choose Custom airdop to call in when you get enough F.U.N.C (In game currency)
-Injection Buffs
-You can set snares to trap enemies like rabbits
-Pretend to be teemo with the blowgun
-No pay to win micro transaction bs


Cons
- US only server (not had a problem with lag yet and im UK based)
- Not greatly optimized but still definitely playable at 60fps
- 3 player co-op teams pls
- Some texture bugs
- Character customization is OK but could be a lot better

I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS GAME

reviewText:
Early Access Review

30h Logged, time to review.

Let me tell you a story!

....and suddenly i was in a box and i hear water and after a while the box just explodes open and i see jungle, some buildings far away and lots of water. As soon as i start walking around someone shouts some gibberish about somebody getting absolutely wreck'd with a knife, i panic. Im running as fast as i can picking stuff from the ground including sticks and rocks and i managed to put two rocks together so hard it transformed to a knife, i was amazed. Still running and there it is, my first encounter with an opponent, he was crafting something and i was smart enought to pick sneaky perk for my first run, i was so near that i could see what hes making and oh boy there was a knife on the ground and stick in hes hand, i was ready to spill some blood. I managed to beat the ♥♥♥♥ out of him, there was loot including a pipe and a bow and some weird stims and i tought well why not use all the stims since i cant hold all these glorious items i managed to hoard, once again i was running with the power of various stims and then the ♥♥♥♥ hit the fan, explosion broke my legs and framerate for a moment and oh boy im in panic running all around bleeding all around, as soon as i realized what actually happened and started patching myself up for some more torture, i died. i died from an impact of an stone.....

That was the first bite in this game and it was deeeeep and the game had me so in it for a while, it amazed me since theres an early acces tag on it.

Currently for me there is only a few problems" that annoy me and im going to list them here:
- on european servers ping is at all times over 70 but under 120.
- im having and slight performance problems with shadows enabled at close combat.
- mouse acceleration cant be turned off at the moment but you can at least turn smoothing off.
- and the god damn F.U.N.C is sometimes up in the tree and i end up running around it since i hear it until i see it.
- some animations are still a bit funny but cmon its still early acces
date:
i can forgive that.

Now the good stuff i like:
- ive experinced just 2 crashes and 1 of them was my own fault for fiddling with things is should not fiddle with.
- i have not encountered any game breaking bugs so far.
- overall performance is great with my current setup.
- the game is everytime the same but at all times different and it keeps dragging me back into it.
- holy balls this is fun with a friend!
- at the beginning i was confused with the inventory system and crafting but i learned to love it suddenly after a while.
- its 1st person view locked.
- tutorial was actually really helpful tought i went in without the tutorial first 3 times just to get the raw picture.

At this very moment i do recommend this game.
5/5 would push stones together so hard that it becomes a knife again.

30.3.2016
After the latest update im even more recommending this game!!

5/5

2.4.2016
110h logged
Devs please stop listening people and make it the way you want it to be.

4/5"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I joined a team game expecting to be matched with some trolling fool but instead I was greeted by a helpful, friendly fellow. I looked forward to the adventures we'd have on the island.

We started off crafting and picking up loot as we travelled through the terrains and as if by magic we were soon stacked with some wonderful tools. He sported the bow and arrow whereas I chose the classic spear. After a few minutes of walking we face our first enemies whom were already in combat with another pairing. My new found friend and I hold back until one of the pairs had been murdered. Finally our chance came; we charged forth, arrows blazing. We took down the already wounded with ease and picked up some great loot. I got myself a rifle and a sword and my compatriot grabbed himself a brand spanking new recurve bow. Our journey then continued.

As we continued walking through the depths of the forest we stumbled across a building. I go ahead to search it through and through but I was stopped in my tracks by some sort of explosive bringing me down to a frightening 1HP. However my good pal seemed to be very clued up in medical sciences as he began to craft bandages out of sticks (I know, crazy right?) I was soon patched up and we began trekking towards the maps centre.

By now there were only 5 left, us, another pair and one lone survivor who'd already lost his partner in crime. We reached the centre, I activated the kill switch and we waited for the fun to begin. However the wait didn't last long as the first pairing came through the brush clearly up for a fight. My trusty partner fended them off with his bow as I went to craft some ammunition for my rifle. I was back just in time as our rival pair had moved up and began engaging in close quarter combat with my buddy. I rushed in firing my only four shots at one of the attackers, filling him with lead, killing him outright. The last of the pair was easy pickings and he was down quickly.

Now it was just the one lonesome survivor and us. We had to win, surely. I was still bleeding from our rival’s offensive bringing me down to 1HP again. My partner on the other hand was on half health so I believed we could still win this. All of a sudden in the corner of my eye I saw someone run up the ramp next to me. He wasn't highlighted so I knew it wasn't my partner and incredibly he hadn't noticed me. I wielded my sword, snuck up behind and killed him in one swipe... Nice work genius you just killed your partner" rang out from the announcer’s mouth. As I realised what I had just done an arrow from the bow of our final enemy strikes me in the head killing me instantly. I was flabbergasted; words couldn't describe the disappointment I had brought upon myself. I proceeded to turn my PC off and go for a lonesome walk reflecting on my actions.

R.I.P Partner
date: gone but never forgotten (I'm really sorry!)"
